001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Application;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.LifecycleListener;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureAtlas;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
011import squidpony.squidmath.StatefulRNG;
012
013/**
014 * Default BitmapFonts, a sample image, "stretchable" fonts and icons, and a central RNG for use with libGDX.
015 * All but one of the resources here need to be downloaded separately, to avoid bloating the size of the dependency jar
016 * with many fonts that a game probably won't use. You can download assets in a jar with a release of SquidLib, or
017 * individually from https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/tree/master/assets . The assets you choose should go in the
018 * android/assets (core/assets if you don't have an Android project) subfolder of your game if you use the normal libGDX
019 * setup tool or SquidSetup, or the assets subfolder if you use czyzby's alternate setup tool,
020 * https://github.com/czyzby/gdx-setup . They should not be placed in subdirectories of assets, otherwise this won't be
021 * able to find them.
022 * <br>
023 * The fonts provided are mostly monospaced, with most looking rather similar (straight orthogonal lines and right-angle
024 * curves), but some that look... better than the rest. For monospaced fonts that could be used on a grid in SquidPanel
025 * or SquidLayers, it is recommended that you use a "stretchable" font (which use a signed distance field, or SDF,
026 * effect to stretch smoothly) or a "crisp" font (which use a multi-channel signed distance field, or MSDF, effect to
027 * stretch smoothly and remain sharp at very high zooms). For some usage you may want a TextFamily instead of a normal
028 * TextCellFactory or BitmapFont; these TextFamily fonts store regular, bold, italic, and bold-italic faces in one file,
029 * and {@link GDXMarkup} can produce text that will render in those faces. Some good choices for fonts here are
030 * Iosevka, which comes in a sans-serif version with {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()}, {@link #getCrispLeanFont()}, 
031 * {@link #getCrispLeanFamily()}, and more, as well as a slab-serif version with {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()},
032 * {@link #getCrispSlabFont()}, and {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()}, among others, as well as Inconsolata-LGC, which is
033 * more geometric sans-serif accessible with {@link #getStretchableFont()}, or (well-suited for square glyphs)
034 * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()} (it does not have a crisp variety). Another is Computer Modern, accessible by
035 * {@link #getStretchableTypewriterFont()}, which has a chunky, ornamented style. For variable-width fonts
036 * that can be used in TextPanel, among others, you can use the recommended crisp font family Noto Serif
037 * with {@link #getCrispPrintFamily()}, or for stretchable fonts there's the serif font Gentium with
038 * {@link #getStretchablePrintFont()} or Noto Sans with {@link #getStretchableCleanFont()} (Noto Sans currently has
039 * problems that Noto Serif does not have). All of the fonts so far support the Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic alphabets.
040 * <br>
041 * If you can't decide, go with {@link #getCrispLeanFont()} or {@link #getCrispSlabFont()}, which return TextCellFactory
042 * objects, and call their .width(int), .height(int), and .initBySize() methods to make them the size (and aspect ratio)
043 * you want. You can use stretchable or crisp fonts with equal width and height to make
044 * a horizontally-stretched version of a square font instead of the existing square fonts that add blank space.
045 * <br>
046 * The most Latin script support for a monospaced font is in the font Mandrill, accessible by getDefaultUnicodeFont()
047 * and getLargeUnicodeFont() in two different sizes, and the latter should be suitable for everything from Spanish and
048 * French, to Polish to Vietnamese. You can use Gentium for even better language support with a variable-width font in
049 * TextPanel or the like; it is accessible with getStretchablePrintFont(). Google's Noto font also supports many glyphs
050 * in a variable-width format; it is accessible with getStretchableCleanFont() but may have some issues with baseline
051 * level changing and character-to-character alignment seeming too high or low.
052 * <br>
053 * The sample image is a tentacle taken from a public domain icon collection graciously released by Henrique Lazarini;
054 * it's fitting for SquidLib to have a tentacle as a logo or something, I guess?
055 * <br>
056 * The icons are from http://game-icons.net , there are over 2000 of them, and they're among the only images that should
057 * both be recolor-able easily (like chars in a font) and resize-able easily if you use a stretchable font at the same
058 * time. The stretchable font TextCellFactories do some work with shaders that makes most images look incorrect, but
059 * allow distance field fonts and these distance field icons to resize smoothly. Mixing stretchable fonts with
060 * non-stretchable images or fonts is not a great idea, and usually involves a slow shader change back and forth.
061 * <br>
062 * You can get a default RNG with getGuiRandom(); this should probably not be reused for non-GUI-related randomness,
063 * but is meant instead to be used wherever randomized purely-aesthetic effects are needed, such as a jiggling effect.
064 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 7/11/2015.
065 */
066public class DefaultResources implements LifecycleListener {

148    public static final String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
149            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
150            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
151            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
152            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
153            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
154            + "\n"
155            + "void main() {\n"
156            + " v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
157            + " v_color.a = v_color.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
158            + " v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
159            + " gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
160            + "}\n";
161
162    public static final String fragmentShader = "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
163            + " precision mediump float;\n"
164            + " precision mediump int;\n"
165            + "#endif\n"
166            + "\n"
167            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
168            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
169            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
170            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
171            + "\n"
172            + "void main() {\n"
173            + "  if (u_smoothing > 0.0) {\n"
174            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000125, v_texCoords+0.000125);\n"
175            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).a) +\n"
176            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).a) +\n"
177            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).a) +\n"
178            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).a);\n"
179            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, ((smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).a) + 0.5 * asum) / 3.0) * v_color.a);\n"
180            + "  } else {\n"
181            + "         gl_FragColor = v_color * texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n"
182            + "  }\n"
183            + "}\n";

190//            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
191//            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"

193//            + "\n"
194//            + "void main() {\n"

196//            + "               float distance = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).a;\n"

203    public static final String msdfFragmentShader =  "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
204            + " precision mediump float;\n"
205            + " precision mediump int;\n"
206            + "#endif\n"
207            + "\n"
208            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
209            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
210            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
211            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
212            + "\n"
213            + "void main() {\n"
214            + "  vec3 sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
215            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) * u_smoothing + 0.5, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
216            //+ " float dist = (max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (2.75 * u_smoothing);\n"
217            //+ " float d = u_smoothing * 1.75;\n" 
218            //+ " float d = fwidth(dist);\n"
219            //+ " float alpha = clamp(dist + 0.5, 0.0, 1.0);\n"
220            //+ " float alpha = smoothstep(-d, d, dist);\n"
221            //+ " if(alpha == 0) { discard; }\n"
222            //+ "       gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, alpha * v_color.a);\n"
223
224            //+ "        vec3 sdf;\n"
225            //+ "        vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.0000625, v_texCoords+0.0000625);\n"
226            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).rgb;\n"
227            //+ "        float asum = clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (6.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.5, 0.0, 0.5);\n"
228            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).rgb;\n"
229            //+ "  asum = asum + clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (6.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.5, 0.0, 0.5); +\n"
230            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).rgb;\n"
231            //+ "  asum = asum + clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (6.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.5, 0.0, 0.5); +\n"
232            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).rgb;\n"
233            //+ "  asum = asum + clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (6.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.5, 0.0, 0.5); +\n"
234            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
235            //+ "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, clamp(((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.625) / (3.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.625 + asum) / 3.0, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
236            + "}\n";
237    /**
238     * An alternate shader based on {@link DefaultResources#fragmentShader}, but this draws outlines around characters.
239     * Only works with distance field fonts. You probably need to create a new ShaderProgram to use this, which would
240     * look like {@code new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.outlineFragmentShader)}, and
241     * would assign this to your TextCellFactory's {@link TextCellFactory#shader} field after the TextCellFactory is
242     * fully initialized (calling {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()}) will set the shader back to the default).
243     */
244    public static final String outlineFragmentShader = "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
245            + "precision mediump float;\n"
246            + "precision mediump int;\n"
247            + "#endif\n"
248            + "\n"
249            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
250            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
251            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
252            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
253            + "\n"
254            + "void main() {\n"
255            + "  if(u_smoothing <= 0.0) {\n"
256            + "    float smoothing = -u_smoothing;\n"
257            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000125, v_texCoords+0.000125);\n"
258            + "    vec2 sample0 = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
259            + "    vec2 sample1 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).ra;\n"
260            + "    vec2 sample2 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).ra;\n"
261            + "    vec2 sample3 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).ra;\n"
262            + "    vec2 sample4 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).ra;\n"
263            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample0.x, sample0.y)) + 0.5 * (\n"
264            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample1.x, sample1.y)) +\n"
265            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample2.x, sample2.y)) +\n"
266            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample3.x, sample3.y)) +\n"
267            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample4.x, sample4.y)));\n"
268            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, (asum / 3.0) * v_color.a);\n"
269            + "  } else {\n"
270            + "    vec2 radistance = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
271            + "    float distance = min(radistance.x, radistance.y);\n"
272//            + "          vec2 box = vec2(0.0, 0.00375 * (u_smoothing + 0.0825));\n"
273//            + "          float asum = 0.7 * (smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, distance) + \n"
274//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords + box.xy).a) +\n"
275//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords - box.xy).a) +\n"
276//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords + box.yx).a) +\n"
277//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords - box.yx).a)),\n"
278            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000625, v_texCoords+0.000625);\n"
279            + "    vec2 sample0 = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
280            + "    vec2 sample1 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).ra;\n"
281            + "    vec2 sample2 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).ra;\n"
282            + "    vec2 sample3 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).ra;\n"
283            + "    vec2 sample4 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).ra;\n"
284            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample0.x, sample0.y)) + 0.5 * (\n"
285            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample1.x, sample1.y)) +\n"
286            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample2.x, sample2.y)) +\n"
287            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample3.x, sample3.y)) +\n"
288            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample4.x, sample4.y))),\n"
289//            + "                 char = step(distance, 0.35);\n"
290            + "                 fancy = step(0.55, distance);\n"
291//            + "                 outline = clamp((distance * 0.8 - 0.415) * 18.0, 0.0, 1.0);\n"
292            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb * fancy, (asum + step(0.3, distance)) * v_color.a);\n"
293            + "  }\n"
294            + "}\n";
295    /**
296     * An alternate shader based on {@link DefaultResources#msdfFragmentShader}, but this draws outlines around
297     * characters. This should be sharper than {@link #outlineFragmentShader},  but only works with MSDF (crisp) fonts.
298     * Unlike that shader, this doesn't have special behavior for negative
299     * {@link TextCellFactory#getSmoothingMultiplier()} values, though that may be added later.
300     * You probably need to create a new ShaderProgram to use this, which would look like
301     * {@code new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.msdfOutlineFragmentShader)}, and
302     * would assign this to your TextCellFactory's {@link TextCellFactory#shader} field after the TextCellFactory is
303     * fully initialized (calling {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()}) will set the shader back to the default).
304     */
305    public static final String msdfOutlineFragmentShader =  "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
306            + " precision mediump float;\n"
307            + " precision mediump int;\n"
308            + "#endif\n"
309            + "\n"
310            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
311            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
312            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
313            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
314            + "\n"
315            + "void main() {\n"
316            + "  vec3 sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
317//            + "  float distance = (max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.425);\n"
318//            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(step(3.5 * u_smoothing, distance * 0.75) * v_color.rgb, clamp((distance / (3.4 * u_smoothing)) + 0.9125, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
319
320            //+ "  float cd = clamp(distance, 0.0, 1.0);"
321
322            + "  float d = ((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b))) - 0.4);\n"
323            + "  float block = step(-0.4999999, d);\n"
324            + "  float nice = step(0.24999999, d);\n"
325            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb * nice, clamp(d * u_smoothing + (block + 1.0) * 0.5, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
326            + "}\n";
327
328    private SquidColorCenter scc;
329    private Texture tentacle;
330    private TextureRegion tentacleRegion;
331    private StatefulRNG guiRandom;
332
333    private static DefaultResources instance;
334
335    static BitmapFont copyFont(BitmapFont font)
336    {
337        if(font == null) return new BitmapFont();
338        return new BitmapFont(new BitmapFont.BitmapFontData(font.getData().getFontFile(), false),
339                font.getRegions(), font.usesIntegerPositions());
340    }
341    private DefaultResources()
342    {
343        if(Gdx.app == null)
344            throw new IllegalStateException("Gdx.app cannot be null; initialize GUI-using objects in create() or later.");
345        Gdx.app.addLifecycleListener(this);
346    }
347
348    private static void initialize()
349    {
350        if(instance == null)
351            instance = new DefaultResources();
352    }
353
354    /**
355     * Gets the one font guaranteed to be included in libGDX, which is Arial at size 15 px.
356     * @return the BitmapFont representing Arial.ttf at size 15 px
357     */
358    public static BitmapFont getIncludedFont()
359    {
360        initialize();
361        if(instance.arial15 == null)
362        {
363            try {
364                instance.arial15 = new BitmapFont();
365                //instance.narrow1.getData().padBottom = instance.narrow1.getDescent();
366            } catch (Exception ignored) {
367            }
368        }
369        return copyFont(instance.arial15);
370    }
371    /**
372     * Returns a 12x12px, stretched but curvaceous font as an embedded resource. Caches it for later calls.
373     * <br>
374     * Needs files:
375     * <ul>
376     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt</li>
377     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Zodiac-Square-12x12.png</li>
378     * </ul>
379     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Zodiac-Square.ttf at size 16 pt
380     */
381    public static BitmapFont getDefaultFont()
382    {
383        initialize();
384        if(instance.square1 == null)
385        {
386            try {
387                instance.square1 = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(squareName), Gdx.files.internal(squareTexture), false);
388                //instance.square1.getData().padBottom = instance.square1.getDescent();
389            } catch (Exception ignored) {
390            }
391        }
392        return copyFont(instance.square1);
393    }

585    /**
586     * Returns a 25x25px, very smooth and generally good-looking font (based on Inconsolata) as an embedded resource.
587     * This font fully supports Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and of particular interest to SquidLib, Box Drawing characters.
588     * This variant is (almost) perfectly square, and box drawing characters should line up at size 25x25 px, but other
589     * glyphs will have much more horizontal spacing than in other fonts. Caches the font for later calls. You may want
590     * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()} instead, which is the same font but can stretch smoothly to most sizes.
591     * <br>
592     * Needs files:
593     * <ul>
594     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-25x25.fnt</li>
595     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-25x25.png</li>
596     * </ul>
597     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Inconsolata-LGC-Square at size 25x25 pixels
598     */
599    public static BitmapFont getSquareSmoothFont()
600    {
601        initialize();
602        if(instance.smoothSquare == null)
603        {
604            try {
605                instance.smoothSquare = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(smoothSquareName), Gdx.files.internal(smoothSquareTexture), false);
606                //instance.smoothSquare.getData().padBottom = instance.smoothSquare.getDescent();
607            } catch (Exception ignored) {
608            }
609        }
610        return copyFont(instance.smoothSquare);
611    }
612    /**

614     * The font builds on work by Christian Munk in his font called Monotwist, making some changes for legibility.
615     * This font has the lowest width of any font asset distributed with SquidLib. Caches the font for later calls.
616     * Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the
617     * license file linked below.
618     * <br>
619     * Needs files:
620     * <ul>
621     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-4x10.fnt</li>
622     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-4x10.png</li>
623     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-license.txt</li>
624     * </ul>
625     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Monty.ttf at size 8 pt
626     */

634                //instance.narrow1.getData().padBottom = instance.narrow1.getDescent();
635            } catch (Exception ignored) {
636            }
637        }
638        return copyFont(instance.tiny);
639    }
640    /**
641     * Returns a 8x20px, extremely thin font (that may be barely legible) as an embedded resource.
642     * The font builds on work by Christian Munk in his font called Monotwist, making some changes for legibility.
643     * A smaller version of this font, {@link #getTinyFont()}, has the lowest width of any font asset distributed with
644     * SquidLib; this doubles its resolution in case you like its appearance but don't want to go blind. Caches the font
645     * for later calls. Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font;
646     * this is in the license file linked below.
647     * <br>
648     * Needs files:
649     * <ul>
650     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-8x20.fnt</li>
651     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-8x20.png</li>
652     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-license.txt</li>
653     * </ul>
654     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Monty.ttf at size 16 pt
655     */

660        {

663            } catch (Exception ignored) {
664            }
665        }
666        return copyFont(instance.lessTiny);
667    }
668    /**
669     * Returns a 7x12px font with identical (excellent) Unicode coverage to Iosevka, as an embedded resource.
670     * The font is 7-12-serif by Christian Munk, but not all of the Unicode glyphs supported in his amazingly-huge font
671     * are present here; just the subset that's compatible with Iosevka (which is way more than is required for SquidLib
672     * to present most things). Caches the font for later calls, but be aware that if you copy the BitmapFont instead of
673     * calling this method again, it won't stay monospaced because of a quirk of libGDX. Attribution to Christian Munk
674     * (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the license file linked below.
675     * <br>
676     * Needs files:
677     * <ul>
678     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif.fnt</li>
679     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif.png</li>
680     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif-license.txt</li>
681     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif-readme.txt</li>
682     * </ul>
683     * @return the BitmapFont object representing 7-12-serif.ttf at a size that gives exactly 7 px wide by 12 px tall
684     */
685    public static BitmapFont getSevenTwelveFont()
686    {
687        initialize();
688        if(instance.sevenTwelve == null)
689        {
690            try {
691                instance.sevenTwelve = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(sevenTwelveName), Gdx.files.internal(sevenTwelveTexture), false);
692            } catch (Exception ignored) {
693            }
694        }
695        final BitmapFont cpy = copyFont(instance.sevenTwelve);
696        cpy.setFixedWidthGlyphs(" !\"#$%&'()*+,-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\\]^_`abcdefghijklmno\n" +
697                "pqrstuvwxyz{|}~\u00AD\n" +
698                "\n" +
699                "\n" +
700                "\n" +
701                "\n" +
702                "\n" +
703                "\n" +
704                "\n" +
705                "\n" +
706                "\n" +
707                "\n" +
708                "\n" +
709                "\n" +
710                "\n" +
711                "\n" +
712                "\n" +
713                "\n" +
714                "\n" +
715                "\n" +
716                "\n" +
717                "\n" +
718                "\n" +
719                "\n" +
720                "\n" +
721                "\n" +
722                "\n" +
723                "\n" +
724                "\n" +
725                "\u200B\u200C\u200D\u200E\u200F\u2028\u2029\u202A\u202B\u202C\u202D\u202E\n" +
726                "\u2060\u2061\u2062\u2063\u2064\u2066\u2067\u2068\u2069\u206A\u206B\u206C\u206D\u206E\u206F\n" +
727                "\n" +
728                "\n" +
729                "\n" +
730                "\n" +
731                "\n" +
732                "\n" +
733                "\n" +
734                "\n" +
735                "\n" +
736                "\n" +
737                "\n" +
738                "\n" +
739                "\n" +
740                "\n" +
741                "\n" +
742                "\n" +
743                "\n" +
744                "\n" +
745                "\n" +
746                "\n" +
747                "\n" +
748                "\n" +
749                "\n" +
750                "\n" +
751                "\n" +
752                "\n" +
753                "\n" +
754                "\n" +
755                "\n" +
756                "\n" +
757                "\n" +
758                "\n" +
759                "\n" +
760                "\n" +
761                "\n" +
762                "\n" +
763                "\n" +
764                "");
765        return cpy;
766    }
767    /**
768     * Returns a 14x27px font with fairly good Unicode coverage and an octagonal, angular look, as an embedded resource.
769     * The font is Computer Says No by Christian Munk, which has a nice clean appearance. Caches the font for later
770     * calls, but be aware that if you copy the BitmapFont instead of calling this method again, it won't stay
771     * monospaced because of a quirk of libGDX. Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used,
772     * CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the license file linked below.
773     * <br>
774     * Needs files:
775     * <ul>
776     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo.fnt</li>
777     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo.png</li>
778     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo-license.txt</li>
779     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo-readme.txt</li>
780     * </ul>
781     * @return the BitmapFont object representing ComputerSaysNo.ttf at a size that gives about 14 px wide by 27 px tall
782     */
783    public static BitmapFont getOctagonalMonoFont()
784    {
785        initialize();
786        if(instance.computerSaysNo == null)
787        {
788            try {
789                instance.computerSaysNo = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(computerSaysNoName), Gdx.files.internal(computerSaysNoTexture), false);
790            } catch (Exception e) {
791                instance.computerSaysNo = new BitmapFont();
792            }
793        }
794        final BitmapFont cpy = copyFont(instance.computerSaysNo);
795        // ugh, this shouldn't be required...
796        cpy.setFixedWidthGlyphs("\u0000" +
797                " !\"#$%&'()*+,-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\\]^_`abcdefghijklmno\n" +
798                "pqrstuvwxyz{|}~\u00AD\n" +
799                "\n" +
800                "\n" +
801                "\n" +
802                "\n" +
803                "\n" +
804                "\n" +
805                "\n" +
806                "\n" +
807                "\n" +
808                "\n" +
809                "\n" +
810                "\n" +
811                "\n" +
812                "\n" +
813                "\n" +
814                "\n" +
815                "\n" +
816                "\n" +
817                "\n" +
818                "\n" +
819                "\n" +
820                "\n" +
821                "\n" +
822                "\n" +
823                "\n" +
824                "\n" +
825                "\n" +
826                "\n" +
827                "\n" +
828                "\n" +
829                "\n" +
830                "");
831        return cpy;
832    }

834    /**

836     * icons. The font is <a href="https://github.com/slavfox/Cozette">Cozette by slavfox</a>. Caches the font for later
837     * calls. Attribution is not required; Cozette is MIT-licensed, and we aren't distributing any of its files. Still,
838     * credit goes to slavfox for this nice, highly-usable font.
839     * <br>
840     * Needs files:
841     * <ul>
842     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Cozette.fnt</li>

844     * </ul>

846     */

851        {
852            try {
853                instance.cozette = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(cozetteName), Gdx.files.internal(cozetteTexture), false);
854            } catch (Exception ignored) {
855            }
856        }
857        return copyFont(instance.cozette);
858    }
859
860    /**
861     * Returns a 7x14px pixel font with broad coverage of Unicode, including Greek, Cyrillic, Braille, and tech-related
862     * icons, with a black outline applied around the white inner strokes. The outline typically won't be colored when
863     * the rest of the font is, but the inner stroke changes color normally. The font is
864     * <a href="https://github.com/slavfox/Cozette">Cozette by slavfox</a>. Caches the font for later
865     * calls. Attribution is not required; Cozette is MIT-licensed, and we aren't distributing any of its files. Still,
866     * credit goes to slavfox for this nice, highly-usable font.
867     * <br>
868     * Using this font in a TextCellFactory is experimental; it should be usable in scene2d.ui widgets, though.
869     * <br>
870     * Needs files:
871     * <ul>
872     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CozetteOutlined.fnt</li>
873     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CozetteOutlined.png</li>
874     * </ul>
875     * @return the BitmapFont object representing CozetteVector.ttf at size 12 pt with a square outline applied
876     */
877    public static BitmapFont getCozyOutlinedFont()
878    {
879        initialize();
880        if(instance.cozetteOutlined == null)
881        {
882            try {
883                instance.cozetteOutlined = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(cozetteOutlinedName), Gdx.files.internal(cozetteOutlinedTexture), false);
884            } catch (Exception ignored) {
885            }
886        }
887        return copyFont(instance.cozetteOutlined);
888    }

890    /**
891     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a square font that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches
892     * the result for later calls.
893     * <br>
894     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/DD1RkPa.png
895     * <br>
896     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
897     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
898     * <br>
899     * Needs files:
900     * <ul>
901     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-distance.fnt</li>
902     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-distance.png</li>
903     * </ul>
904     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the square font Inconsolata-LGC-Square.ttf
905     */
906    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableSquareFont()
907    {
908        initialize();
909        if(instance.distanceSquare == null)
910        {
911            try {
912                instance.distanceSquare = new TextCellFactory().defaultDistanceFieldFont();
913            } catch (Exception ignored) {
914            }
915        }
916        if(instance.distanceSquare != null)
917            return instance.distanceSquare.copy();
918        return null;
919    }

921    /**
922     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use an blocky, fairly-bold square font that should scale cleanly
923     * to many sizes. Unlike {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially,
924     * and is not a distorted/stretched version of an existing font. Caches the result for later calls.
925     * <br>
926     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 2.125f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
927     * <br>
928     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nIjgTOp.png">Preview at 6x6 size, https://i.imgur.com/nIjgTOp.png</a>
929     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/lWaSgVN.png">Preview at much larger size, https://i.imgur.com/lWaSgVN.png</a>
930     * <br>
931     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
932     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
933     * <br>
934     * Needs files:
935     * <ul>
936     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/BoxedIn-distance.fnt</li>
937     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/BoxedIn-distance.png</li>
938     * </ul>
939     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the square font BoxedIn.ttf
940     */
941    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableHeavySquareFont()
942    {
943        initialize();
944        if(instance.distanceHeavySquare == null)
945        {
946            try {
947                instance.distanceHeavySquare = new TextCellFactory()
948                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldHeavySquare, distanceFieldHeavySquareTexture)
949                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(2.125f);
950            } catch (Exception ignored) {
951            }
952        }
953        if(instance.distanceHeavySquare != null)
954            return instance.distanceHeavySquare.copy();
955        return null;
956    }

958    /**
959     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use an all-caps (with lighter-weight versions of upper-case
960     * letters for the lower-case glyphs) square font that should scale cleanly to many sizes.
961     * Unlike {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially, and is not a
962     * distorted/stretched version of an existing font. This font only supports ASCII, and as said before, it doesn't
963     * have separate lower-case letters. Note: if you use this font as-is, most characters will overlap slightly with
964     * each other, which can be an aesthetic benefit in some styles but can also be hard to read, at least if the colors
965     * aren't different between overlapping characters. For that reason, you may want to tweak the width and height of
966     * this font after passing it to a SquidLayers or SparseLayers; often you would pass 0.875 times the original
967     * width and height to {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} and {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)}.
968     * Caches the result for later calls. The font is "square" by Wouter van Oortmerssen; it is available under a
969     * CC-BY-3.0 license, which requires attribution to Wouter van Oortmerssen if you use it.
970     * <br>
971     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 6f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
972     * <br>
973     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nvHl64v.png">Preview at large size</a>
974     * <br>
975     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
976     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
977     * <br>
978     * Needs files:
979     * <ul>
980     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-msdf.fnt</li>
981     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-msdf.png</li>
982     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-License.txt</li>
983     * </ul>
984     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font square.ttf
985     */
986    public static TextCellFactory getCrispCurvySquareFont()
987    {
988        initialize();
989        if(instance.msdfCurvySquare == null)
990        {
991            try {
992                instance.msdfCurvySquare = new TextCellFactory()
993                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCurvySquare, crispCurvySquareTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(6f);
994            } catch (Exception ignored) {
995            }
996        }
997        if(instance.msdfCurvySquare != null)
998            return instance.msdfCurvySquare.copy();
999        return null;
1000    }

1002    /**
1003     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a square font with 45-degree angled sections, based on the
1004     * typeface used on the Atari ST console, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Unlike
1005     * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially, and is not a
1006     * distorted/stretched version of an existing font. This font only supports ASCII, but it supports all of it, unlike
1007     * {@link #getCrispCurvySquareFont()}. Caches the result for later calls. The font is "a-starry", based on "Atari ST
1008     * (low-res)" by Damien Guard; it is available under a CC-BY-SA-3.0 license, which requires attribution to Damien
1009     * Guard (and technically Tommy Ettinger, because he made changes in a-starry) if you use it.
1010     * <br>
1011     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 3f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1012     * <br>
1013     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nvHl64v.png">Preview at large size</a>
1014     * <br>
1015     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1016     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1017     * <br>
1018     * Needs files:
1019     * <ul>
1020     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-msdf.fnt</li>
1021     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-msdf.png</li>
1022     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-license.txt</li>
1023     * </ul>
1024     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font a-starry.ttf
1025     */
1026    public static TextCellFactory getCrispOctagonalSquareFont()
1027    {
1028        initialize();

1030        {
1031            try {
1032                instance.msdfOctagonalSquare = new TextCellFactory()
1033                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispOctagonalSquare, crispOctagonalSquareTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(3f);
1034            } catch (Exception ignored) {
1035            }
1036        }
1037        if(instance.msdfOctagonalSquare != null)
1038            return instance.msdfOctagonalSquare.copy();
1039        return null;
1040    }

1108    /**
1109     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with broad Unicode support
1110     * that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Source Code Pro, an
1111     * open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Adobe, and it has good Unicode support among the fixed-width
1112     * fonts used by SquidLib. It may be a good choice for science-fiction games because of its modern feel, but the
1113     * legibility enhancements made so the font could be usable in text editors also are nice for all text-based games.
1114     * The high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly
1115     * pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell width of 15 and cell height of 27 is ideal;
1116     * this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports.
1117     * <br>
1118     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/VC0xn2r.png
1119     * <br>
1120     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1121     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1122     * <br>
1123     * Needs files:
1124     * <ul>
1125     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceCodePro-Medium-distance.fnt</li>
1126     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceCodePro-Medium-distance.png</li>
1127     * </ul>
1128     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font SourceCodePro-Medium.otf
1129     */
1130    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCodeFont()
1131    {
1132        initialize();
1133        if(instance.distanceCode == null)
1134        {
1135            try {
1136                instance.distanceCode = new TextCellFactory()
1137                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldCode, distanceFieldCodeTexture);
1138            } catch (Exception e) {
1139                e.printStackTrace();
1140            }
1141        }
1142        if(instance.distanceCode != null)
1143            return instance.distanceCode.copy();
1144        return null;
1145    }
1146    /**
1147     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with strong CJK support (in
1148     * particular, very good coverage for Japanese) that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later
1149     * calls. The font used is Source Han Code JP, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Adobe, and it has
1150     * the best CJK char support among the fonts used by SquidLib. It is extremely wide if used only for English text,
1151     * which may be desirable to make square cells. The very high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph
1152     * is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell
1153     * width of 19 and cell height of 20 is ideal; this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes.
1154     * <br>
1155     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.125f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1156     * <br>
1157     * Preview: https://i.imgur.com/g65jXxB.png
1158     * <br>
1159     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1160     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1161     * <br>
1162     * Needs files:
1163     * <ul>
1164     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceHanCodeJP-Regular-distance.fnt</li>
1165     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceHanCodeJP-Regular-distance.png</li>
1166     * </ul>
1167     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font SourceHanCodeJP-Regular.otf
1168     */
1169    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCodeJPFont()
1170    {
1171        initialize();
1172        if(instance.distanceCodeJP == null)
1173        {
1174            try {
1175                instance.distanceCodeJP = new TextCellFactory()
1176                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldCodeJP, distanceFieldCodeJPTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.125f);
1177            } catch (Exception e) {
1178                e.printStackTrace();
1179            }
1180        }
1181        if(instance.distanceCodeJP != null)
1182            return instance.distanceCodeJP.copy();
1183        return null;
1184    }
1185    /**
1186     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1187     * and a thin, geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font
1188     * used is Iosevka, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1189     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1190     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1191     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1192     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1193     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1194     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1195     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1196     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this sans-serif version of Iosevka and the slab-serif
1197     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1198     * also versions of Iosevka that use a Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()} and
1199     * {@link #getStretchableSlabLightFont()}.
1200     * <br>
1201     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/sm0ULbU.png
1202     * <br>
1203     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1204     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1205     * <br>
1206     * Needs files:
1207     * <ul>
1208     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-distance.fnt</li>
1209     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-distance.png</li>
1210     * </ul>
1211     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf
1212     */
1213    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableLeanFont()
1214    {
1215        initialize();
1216        if(instance.distanceLean == null)
1217        {
1218            try {
1219                instance.distanceLean = new TextCellFactory()
1220                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldLean, distanceFieldLeanTexture);
1221            } catch (Exception e) {
1222                e.printStackTrace();
1223            }
1224        }
1225        if(instance.distanceLean != null)
1226            return instance.distanceLean.copy();
1227        return null;
1228    }

1230    /**
1231     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1232     * and a slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The
1233     * font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1234     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1235     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1236     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1237     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1238     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1239     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1240     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1241     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1242     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1243     * also versions of Iosevka that use a Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()} and
1244     * {@link #getStretchableSlabLightFont()}.
1245     * <br>

1249     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1250     * <br>
1251     * Needs files:
1252     * <ul>
1253     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-distance.fnt</li>
1254     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-distance.png</li>
1255     * </ul>
1256     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf
1257     */

1264                instance.distanceSlab = new TextCellFactory()

1266            } catch (Exception e) {
1267                e.printStackTrace();
1268            }
1269        }
1270        if(instance.distanceSlab != null)
1271            return instance.distanceSlab.copy();
1272        return null;

1274    /**
1275     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1276     * and a very thin, geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The
1277     * font used is Iosevka (at Light weight), an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1278     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1279     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1280     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1281     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1282     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1283     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1284     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1285     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this sans-serif version of Iosevka and the slab-serif
1286     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableSlabLightFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1287     * also versions of Iosevka that do not use this Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()} and
1288     * {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}.

1293     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1294     * <br>

1296     * <ul>

1319    /**
1320     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1321     * and a very thin, slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later
1322     * calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style at Light weight, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface
1323     * by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to
1324     * Iosevka's special build process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and
1325     * Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count
1326     * means the part of the image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts
1327     * small and is resized to much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate
1328     * multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an
1329     * aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A
1330     * tour de force that deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab
1331     * serifs and the other version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()}, though they have subtly
1332     * different sizes. There are also versions of Iosevka that do not use this Light weight, available by
1333     * {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()} and {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}.
1334     * <br>
1335     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/B5eSGfj.png
1336     * <br>
1337     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1338     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1339     * <br>
1340     * Needs files:
1341     * <ul>
1342     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Light-distance.fnt</li>
1343     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Light-distance.png</li>
1344     * </ul>
1345     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab-Light.ttf
1346     */
1347    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableSlabLightFont()
1348    {
1349        initialize();
1350        if(instance.distanceSlabLight == null)
1351        {
1352            try {
1353                instance.distanceSlabLight = new TextCellFactory()
1354                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldSlabLight, distanceFieldSlabLightTexture);
1355            } catch (Exception e) {
1356                e.printStackTrace();
1357            }
1358        }
1359        if(instance.distanceSlabLight != null)
1360            return instance.distanceSlabLight.copy();
1361        return null;
1362    }
1363    
1364    /**
1365     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a font with extremely wide Unicode support that should scale
1366     * cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font is DejaVu Sans Mono, a common font on Linux
1367     * operating systems and a clean-looking, legible font, though it has some visual quirks like a "tail" on lower-case
1368     * 'l', that take some getting used to. A possible requirement for this font is that the size of the text in a
1369     * SquidPanel or SquidLayers may need to be increased 1-5 pixels past what the cell width and height are; this can
1370     * be done with {@link SquidPanel#setTextSize(float, float)} or {@link SquidLayers#setTextSize(float, float)},
1371     * giving 1-2 more than the cell width for x and 3-5 more than the cell height for y.
1372     * <br>
1373     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/1haETOe.png
1374     * <br>
1375     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1376     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1377     * <br>
1378     * Needs files:
1379     * <ul>
1380     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-distance.fnt</li>
1381     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-distance.png</li>
1382     * </ul>
1383     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font DejaVuSansMono.ttf
1384     */
1385    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableDejaVuFont()
1386    {
1387        initialize();
1388        if(instance.distanceDejaVu == null)
1389        {
1390            try {
1391                instance.distanceDejaVu = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldDejaVu, distanceFieldDejaVuTexture);
1392            } catch (Exception e) {
1393                e.printStackTrace();
1394            }
1395        }
1396        if(instance.distanceDejaVu != null)
1397            return instance.distanceDejaVu.copy();
1398        return null;
1399
1400    }
1401    /**
1402     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width serif font that should look like the serif
1403     * fonts used in many novels' main texts, and that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Meant to be used in variable-
1404     * width displays like TextPanel. Caches the result for later calls.
1405     * <br>
1406     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/eIYYt8C.png
1407     * <br>
1408     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1409     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1410     * <br>
1411     * Needs files:
1412     * <ul>
1413     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Gentium-distance.fnt</li>
1414     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Gentium-distance.png</li>
1415     * </ul>
1416     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Gentium, by SIL
1417     */
1418    public static TextCellFactory getStretchablePrintFont() {
1419        initialize();
1420        if (instance.distancePrint == null) {
1421            try {
1422                instance.distancePrint = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldPrint, distanceFieldPrintTexture)
1423                        .height(30).width(7);
1424                instance.distancePrint.bmpFont.setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1425                
1426            } catch (Exception e) {
1427                e.printStackTrace();
1428            }
1429        }
1430        if(instance.distancePrint != null)
1431            return instance.distancePrint.copy();
1432        return null;
1433    }

1435    /**
1436     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font that should have a blocky,
1437     * futuristic look (based on the font Orbitron), and that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Meant to be used in
1438     * variable-width displays like TextPanel. Caches the result for later calls.
1439     * <br>
1440     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.3f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1441     * <br>
1442     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/grJhoMs.png
1443     * <br>
1444     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1445     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1446     * <br>
1447     * Needs files:
1448     * <ul>
1449     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Orbitron-distance.fnt</li>
1450     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Orbitron-distance.png</li>
1451     * </ul>
1452     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Orbitron, by The League of Movable Type
1453     */
1454    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableOrbitFont() {
1455        initialize();
1456        if (instance.distanceOrbit == null) {
1457            try {
1458                instance.distanceOrbit = new TextCellFactory().setDirectionGlyph('')
1459                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldOrbit, distanceFieldOrbitTexture)
1460                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(1.3f).height(30).width(11);
1461            } catch (Exception e) {
1462                e.printStackTrace();
1463            }
1464        }
1465        if(instance.distanceOrbit != null)
1466            return instance.distanceOrbit.copy();
1467        return null;
1468    }

1470    /**
1471     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font that currently looks
1472     * slightly jumbled without certain layout features. Meant to be used in variable-width displays like TextPanel, but
1473     * currently you should prefer getStretchablePrintFont() for legibility. Caches the result for later calls.
1474     * <br>
1475     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 0.8, instead of the default 1.2f. If you set the smoothing multiplier
1476     * yourself, it should be similarly smaller than what other fonts use (most fonts are 1.2, so multiplying whatever
1477     * you would normally set the smoothing multiplier to by 0.66f should work).
1478     * <br>
1479     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/GF5qQxn.png
1480     * <br>
1481     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1482     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1483     * <br>
1484     * Needs files:
1485     * <ul>
1486     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Noto-Sans-distance.fnt</li>
1487     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Noto-Sans-distance.png</li>
1488     * </ul>
1489     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Noto Sans, by Google
1490     */
1491    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCleanFont() {
1492        initialize();
1493        if (instance.distanceClean == null) {
1494            try {
1495                instance.distanceClean = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldClean, distanceFieldCleanTexture)
1496                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(0.8f).height(30).width(5);
1497                instance.distanceClean.bmpFont.setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1498            } catch (Exception e) {
1499                e.printStackTrace();
1500            }
1501        }
1502        if(instance.distanceClean != null)
1503            return instance.distanceClean.copy();
1504        return null;
1505    }

1507    /**
1508     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1509     * and a slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes (using an MSDF technique).
1510     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font
1511     * License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations
1512     * thanks to Iosevka's special build process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin,
1513     * Greek, and Cyrillic, but also the necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1514     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1515     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography
1516     * expert) called Iosevka
1517     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>
1518     * <br>
1519     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/YlzFEVX.png">Image link</a>
1520     * <br>
1521     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1522     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1523     * <br>
1524     * Needs files:
1525     * <ul>
1526     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-msdf.fnt</li>
1527     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-msdf.png</li>
1528     * </ul>
1529     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf using MSDF
1530     */
1531    public static TextCellFactory getCrispSlabFont()
1532    {
1533        initialize();
1534        if(instance.msdfSlab == null)
1535        {
1536            try {
1537                instance.msdfSlab = new TextCellFactory()
1538                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispSlab, crispSlabTexture);
1539            } catch (Exception e) {
1540                e.printStackTrace();
1541            }
1542        }
1543        if(instance.msdfSlab != null)
1544            return instance.msdfSlab.copy();
1545        return null;
1546    }
1547    /**
1548     * Not supported; use {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()} instead, using {@link GDXMarkup} to add italics with its
1549     * {@code [/]} tag.
1550     * @return always throws an UnsupportedOperationException
1551     * @deprecated use {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()} instead
1552     */
1553    @Deprecated
1554    public static TextCellFactory getCrispSlabItalicFont()
1555    {
1556        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Use getCrispSlabFamily() instead, with GDXMarkup to add italics.");
1557    }
1558    /**
1559     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1560     * and a sans-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes (using an MSDF technique).
1561     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka, an open-source (SIL Open Font
1562     * License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations
1563     * thanks to Iosevka's special build process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin,
1564     * Greek, and Cyrillic, but also the necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1565     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1566     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography
1567     * expert) called Iosevka
1568     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>
1569     * <br>
1570     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/42rMRz5.png">Image link</a>
1571     * <br>
1572     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1573     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1574     * <br>
1575     * Needs files:
1576     * <ul>
1577     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-msdf.fnt</li>
1578     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-msdf.png</li>
1579     * </ul>
1580     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf
1581     */
1582    public static TextCellFactory getCrispLeanFont()
1583    {
1584        initialize();
1585        if(instance.msdfLean == null)
1586        {
1587            try {
1588                instance.msdfLean = new TextCellFactory()
1589                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispLean, crispLeanTexture);
1590            } catch (Exception e) {
1591                e.printStackTrace();
1592            }
1593        }
1594        if(instance.msdfLean != null)
1595            return instance.msdfLean.copy();
1596        return null;

1598    /**
1599     * Not supported; use {@link #getCrispLeanFamily()} instead, using {@link GDXMarkup} to add italics with its
