1609    /**
1610     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width sans-serif font with excellent Unicode support,
1611     * that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font used is DejaVu
1612     * Sans Mono, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface that is widely used by Linux distros and other groups.
1613     * It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also the
1614     * necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the
1615     * normal Signed Distance Field technique, which should allow sharper edges. It has been updated so it is laid out
1616     * mostly-correctly now; some glyphs may be a little wide, such as {@code @}, but the line height, baseline, and the
1617     * width for most glyphs seem correct. If you find the box drawing characters don't line up, try 
1618     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} with values like 1.125f; the exact value may depend on size.
1619     * <br>
1620     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1621     * <br>
1622     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/SCwhduv.png">Image link</a>
1623     * <br>
1624     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1625     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1626     * <br>
1627     * Needs files:
1628     * <ul>
1629     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-msdf.fnt</li>
1630     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-msdf.png</li>
1631     * </ul>
1632     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font DejaVuSansMono.ttf with an MSDF effect
1633     */
1634    public static TextCellFactory getCrispDejaVuFont()
1635    {
1636        initialize();
1637        if(instance.msdfDejaVu == null)
1638        {
1639            try {
1640                instance.msdfDejaVu = new TextCellFactory()
1641                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispDejaVu, crispDejaVuTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(1f);
1642            } catch (Exception e) {
1643                e.printStackTrace();
1644            }
1645        }
1646        if(instance.msdfDejaVu != null)
1647            return instance.msdfDejaVu.copy();
1648        return null;
1649    }
1650    
1651    /**
1652     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1653     * slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1654     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source
1655     * (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several
1656     * customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs,
1657     * including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the
1658     * necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the part of the
1659     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1660     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1661     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1662     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1663     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1664     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getLeanFamily()}.
1665     * <br>
1666     * <br>
1667     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1668     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1669     * <br>
1670     * Needs files:
1671     * <ul>
1672     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1673     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-distance.png</li>
1674     * </ul>
1675     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf with 4 styles
1676     */
1677    public static TextFamily getSlabFamily()
1678    {
1679        initialize();
1680        if(instance.familySlab == null)
1681        {
1682            try {
1683                instance.familySlab = new TextFamily().defaultFamilySlabDistance();
1684            } catch (Exception e) {
1685                e.printStackTrace();
1686            }
1687        }
1688        if(instance.familySlab != null)
1689            return instance.familySlab.copy();
1690        return null;
1691    }
1692    /**
1693     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1694     * sans-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1695     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka, an open-source (SIL Open Font
1696     * License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations
1697     * thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite
1698     * a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing
1699     * characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph
1700     * is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell
1701     * width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the
1702     * font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert)
1703     * called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>
1704     * You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka without serifs and the other version SquidLib has,
1705     * {@link #getSlabFamily()}.
1706     * <br>
1707     * <br>
1708     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1709     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1710     * <br>
1711     * Needs files:
1712     * <ul>
1713     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1714     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-distance.png</li>
1715     * </ul>
1716     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf with 4 styles
1717     */
1718    public static TextFamily getLeanFamily()
1719    {
1720        initialize();
1721        if(instance.familyLean == null)
1722        {
1723            try {
1724                instance.familyLean = new TextFamily().defaultFamilyLeanDistance();
1725            } catch (Exception e) {
1726                e.printStackTrace();
1727            }
1728        }
1729        if(instance.familyLean != null)
1730            return instance.familyLean.copy();
1731        return null;
1732    }
1733    /**
1734     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a traditional
1735     * serif style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1736     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Go Mono, a typeface released by the team
1737     * behind the Go programming language as open-source (3-clause BSD, the same license as the Go language; the license
1738     * is included with the assets). It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and
1739     * Cyrillic, bu also the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). There's more
1740     * information about this font available where it was introduced,
1741     * <a href="https://blog.golang.org/go-fonts">on the Go blog</a>.
1742     * You may want to try using this Go font family and contrasting it with Iosevka with and without slab serifs, which
1743     * are {@link #getSlabFamily()} and {@link #getLeanFamily()} respectively.
1744     * <br>
1745     * <br>
1746     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1747     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1748     * <br>
1749     * Needs files:
1750     * <ul>
1751     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1752     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-Family-distance.png</li>
1753     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-License.txt</li>
1754     * </ul>
1755     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font GoMono.ttf with 4 styles
1756     */
1757    public static TextFamily getGoFamily()
1758    {
1759        initialize();
1760        if(instance.familyGo == null)
1761        {
1762            try {
1763                instance.familyGo = new TextFamily();
1764                instance.familyGo.fontDistanceField("GoMono-Family-distance.fnt", "GoMono-Family-distance.png");
1765            } catch (Exception e) {
1766                e.printStackTrace();
1767            }
1768        }
1769        if(instance.familyGo != null)
1770            return instance.familyGo.copy();
1771        return null;
1772    }
1773    /**
1774     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1775     * sans-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes (using an MSDF technique) and supports 4
1776     * styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka, an
1777     * open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it 
1778     * uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot
1779     * of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and
1780     * the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the texture
1781     * that holds all four faces of the font is larger than normal, at 4096x4096; this may be too large for some devices
1782     * to load correctly (mostly older phones or tablets). A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some
1783     * approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using
1784     * Viewports.  This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed
1785     * Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips
1786     * on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert) called Iosevka
1787     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a> You may want to
1788     * try using both this version of Iosevka without serifs and the other version SquidLib has with an MSDF effect, 
1789     * {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()}.
1790     * <br>
1791     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/dMVzpEi.png">image link</a>, with bold at the bottom.
1792     * <br>
1793     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1794     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1795     * <br>
1796     * Needs files:
1797     * <ul>
1798     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1799     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-msdf.png</li>
1800     * </ul>
1801     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf with 4 styles and an MSDF effect
1802     */
1803    public static TextFamily getCrispLeanFamily()
1804    {
1805        initialize();
1806        if(instance.familyLeanMSDF == null)
1807        {
1808            try {
1809                instance.familyLeanMSDF = new TextFamily();
1810                instance.familyLeanMSDF.fontMultiDistanceField("Iosevka-Family-msdf.fnt", "Iosevka-Family-msdf.png");
1811            } catch (Exception e) {
1812                e.printStackTrace();
1813            }
1814        }
1815        if(instance.familyLeanMSDF != null)
1816            return instance.familyLeanMSDF.copy();
1817        return null;
1818
1819    }
1820
1821    /**
1822     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1823     * slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes (using an MSDF technique) and supports 4
1824     * styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with
1825     * slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1826     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1827     * process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek,
1828     * and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even 
1829     * for italic text). The high glyph count means the texture that holds all four faces of the font is larger than
1830     * normal, at 4096x4096; this may be too large for some devices to load correctly (mostly older phones or tablets).
1831     * A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this
1832     * allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports.  This uses the Multi-channel Signed
1833     * Distance Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed  Distance Field technique, which gives the
1834     * rendered font sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1835     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1836     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1837     * version SquidLib has with an MSDF effect, {@link #getCrispLeanFamily()}.
1838     * <br>
1839     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.55f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1840     * <br>
1841     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wRNlpL5.png">image link</a>, with bold at the bottom.
1842     * <br>
1843     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1844     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1845     * <br>
1846     * Needs files:
1847     * <ul>
1848     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1849     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.png</li>
1850     * </ul>
1851     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf with 4 styles and an MSDF effect
1852     */
1853    public static TextFamily getCrispSlabFamily()
1854    {
1855        initialize();
1856        if(instance.familySlabMSDF == null)
1857        {
1858            try {
1859                instance.familySlabMSDF = new TextFamily();
1860                instance.familySlabMSDF
1861                        .fontMultiDistanceField("Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.fnt", "Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.png")
1862                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(1.55f);
1863            } catch (Exception e) {
1864                e.printStackTrace();
1865            }
1866        }
1867        if(instance.familySlabMSDF != null)
1868            return instance.familySlabMSDF.copy();
1869        return null;
1870
1871    }
1872    /**
1873     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a variable-width serif font that should look like the serif
1874     * fonts used in many novels' main texts, and that should scale cleanly to many sizes using an MSDF technique, and
1875     * supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is 
1876     * Noto Serif, which is OFL-licensed by Google, and looks very legible in normal use. Meant to be used in
1877     * variable-width displays like TextPanel.
1878     * <br>
1879     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.5f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1880     * <br>
1881     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WsDqSfJ.png">In the foreground message box in ZoneDemo</a>
1882     * <br>
1883     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1884     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1885     * <br>
1886     * Needs files:
1887     * <ul>
1888     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1889     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-Family-msdf.png</li>
1890     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-license.txt</li>
1891     * </ul>
1892     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Noto Serif, made available by Google
1893     */
1894    public static TextFamily getCrispPrintFamily() {
1895        initialize();
1896        if (instance.familyPrintMSDF == null) {
1897            try {
1898                instance.familyPrintMSDF = new TextFamily();
1899                instance.familyPrintMSDF.fontMultiDistanceField(crispNotoSerif, crispNotoSerifTexture)
1900                        .width(7).height(30).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.5f);
1901                instance.familyPrintMSDF.font().setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1902            } catch (Exception e) {
1903                e.printStackTrace();
1904            }
1905        }
1906        if(instance.familyPrintMSDF != null)
1907            return instance.familyPrintMSDF.copy();
1908        return null;
1909    }
1910    /**
1911     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a partially-angular variable-width font with good Unicode
1912     * support and an appearance as if it were carved into solid rock, that should scale cleanly to even very large
1913     * sizes (using an MSDF technique). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is
1914     * <a href="https://fontstruct.com/fontstructions/show/507930/bloccus">Bloccus by Christian Munk</a>. It supports a
1915     * lot of glyphs, including most of extended Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA),
1916     * but not box drawing characters because this is variable-width. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1917     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1918     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
1919     * <br>
1920     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1921     * <br>
1922     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/zaqgHTW.png">Image link</a>
1923     * <br>
1924     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1925     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1926     * <br>
1927     * Needs files:
1928     * <ul>
1929     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-msdf.fnt</li>
1930     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-msdf.png</li>
1931     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-license.txt</li>
1932     * </ul>
1933     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font bloccus.ttf
1934     */
1935    public static TextCellFactory getCrispCarvedFont()
1936    {
1937        initialize();
1938        if(instance.msdfCarved == null)
1939        {
1940            try {
1941                instance.msdfCarved = new TextCellFactory()
1942                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCarved, crispCarvedTexture)
1943                        .width(7f).height(24f).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.0f);
1944            } catch (Exception e) {
1945                e.printStackTrace();
1946            }
1947        }
1948        if(instance.msdfCarved != null)
1949            return instance.msdfCarved.copy();
1950        return null;
1951    }
1952    /**
1953     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font with good Unicode support
1954     * and a no-nonsense look, that should scale cleanly to even very large or small sizes (using an MSDF technique).
1955     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Roboto">Roboto
1956     * Regular by Christian Robertson</a>. It supports a lot of glyphs, including most Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic,
1957     * but not box drawing characters because this is variable-width. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1958     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1959     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
1960     * <br>
1961     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 2f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1962     * <br>
1963     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/ASjdjc6.png">Image link when scaled to a small size</a>
1964     * <br>
1965     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1966     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1967     * <br>
1968     * Needs files:
1969     * <ul>
1970     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-Regular-msdf.fnt</li>
1971     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-Regular-msdf.png</li>
1972     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-License.txt</li>
1973     * </ul>
1974     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Roboto-Regular.ttf
1975     */
1976    public static TextCellFactory getCrispRobotoSansFont()
1977    {
1978        initialize();
1979        if(instance.msdfRoboto == null)
1980        {
1981            try {
1982                instance.msdfRoboto = new TextCellFactory()
1983                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispRobotoSans, crispRobotoSansTexture)
1984                        .width(3f).height(14f).setSmoothingMultiplier(2f);
1985            } catch (Exception e) {
1986                e.printStackTrace();
1987            }
1988        }
1989        if(instance.msdfRoboto != null)
1990            return instance.msdfRoboto.copy();
1991        return null;
1992    }

1994    /**
1995     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width icon font (no letters are supported) using the
1996     * Font-Awesome icon set, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes. Caches the result for later calls.
1997     * The icon font used is the popular Font-Awesome free set (solid style), an open-source (SIL Open Font License)
1998     * typeface that is often used online. You will probably want to consult the cheatsheet for what chars are actually
1999     * supported; <a href="https://fontawesome.com/cheatsheet">the cheatsheet is here</a>. This uses the Multi-channel
2000     * Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which should allow
2001     * sharper edges. You may also want the list of all chars in this icon font; {@link #iconFontAll} has that.
2002     * <br>
2003     * Preview: <a href="">Image link</a>
2004     * <br>
2005     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
2006     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
2007     * <br>
2008     * Needs files:
2009     * <ul>
2010     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/awesome-solid-msdf.fnt</li>
2011     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/awesome-solid-msdf.png</li>
2012     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Font-Awesome-license.txt</li>
2013     * </ul>
2014     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of Font Awesome Free (solid) with an MSDF effect
2015     */
2016    public static TextCellFactory getCrispIconFont()
2017    {
2018        initialize();
2019        if(instance.msdfIcons == null)
2020        {
2021            try {
2022                instance.msdfIcons = new TextCellFactory()
2023                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispIcons, crispIconsTexture);
2024            } catch (Exception e) {
2025                e.printStackTrace();
2026            }
2027        }
2028        if(instance.msdfIcons != null)
2029            return instance.msdfIcons.copy();
2030        return null;
2031
2032    }

2036    /**
2037     * Gets an image of a (squid-like, for SquidLib) tentacle, 32x32px.
2038     * Source is public domain: http://opengameart.org/content/496-pixel-art-icons-for-medievalfantasy-rpg
2039     * Created by Henrique Lazarini (7Soul1, http://7soul1.deviantart.com/ )
2040     * <br>
2041     * Needs file:
2042     * <ul>
2043     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Tentacle.png</li>
2044     * </ul>
2045     * @return a TextureRegion containing an image of a tentacle.
2046     */
2047    public static TextureRegion getTentacle()
2048    {
2049        initialize();
2050        if(instance.tentacle == null || instance.tentacleRegion == null)
2051        {
2052            try {
2053                instance.tentacle = new Texture(Gdx.files.internal("Tentacle.png"));
2054                instance.tentacleRegion = new TextureRegion(instance.tentacle);
2055            } catch (Exception ignored) {
2056            }
2057        }
2058        return instance.tentacleRegion;
2059    }

2062    /**
2063     * Gets a TextureAtlas containing many icons with a distance field effect applied, allowing them to be used with
2064     * "stretchable" fonts and be resized in the same way. These will not look as-expected if stretchable fonts are not
2065     * in use, and will seem hazy and indistinct if the shader hasn't been set up for a distance field effect by
2066     * TextCellFactory (which stretchable fonts will do automatically). The one page of the TextureAtlas is 2048x2048,
2067     * which may be too large for some old, low-end Android phones, and possibly integrated graphics with fairly old
2068     * processors on desktop. It has over 2000 icons.
2069     * <br>
2070     * The icons are CC-BY and the license is distributed with them, though the icons are not necessarily included with
2071     * SquidLib. If you use the icon atlas, be sure to include icons-license.txt with it and reference it with your
2072     * game's license and/or credits information.
2073     * <br>
2074     * Needs files:
2075     * <ul>
2076     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons.atlas</li>
2077     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons.png</li>
2078     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons-license.txt Needed to credit artists</li>
2079     * </ul>
2080     * @return a TextureAtlas containing over 2000 icons with a distance field effect
2081     */
2082    public static TextureAtlas getIconAtlas()
2083    {
2084        initialize();
2085        if(instance.iconAtlas == null)
2086        {
2087            try {
2088                instance.iconAtlas = new TextureAtlas(Gdx.files.internal("icons.atlas"));
2089            } catch (Exception ignored) {
2090            }
2091        }
2092        return instance.iconAtlas;
2093    }

2095    /**
2096     * This is a static global StatefulRNG that's meant for usage in cases where the seed does not matter and any
2097     * changes to this RNG's state will not change behavior elsewhere in the program; this means the GUI mainly.
2098     */
2099    public static StatefulRNG getGuiRandom()
2100    {
2101        initialize();
2102        if(instance.guiRandom == null)
2103        {
2104            instance.guiRandom =  new StatefulRNG();
2105        }
2106        return instance.guiRandom;
2107    }
2108    /**
2109     * This is a static global SquidColorCenter that can be used in places that just need an existing object that can do
2110     * things like analyze hue or saturation of a color.
2111     */
2112    public static SquidColorCenter getSCC()
2113    {
2114        initialize();
2115        if(instance.scc == null)
2116        {
2117            instance.scc =  new SquidColorCenter();
2118        }
2119        return instance.scc;
2120    }
